title: How Zohran Mamdani Beat Back New York’s Elite and Was Elected Mayor
summary: The 34-year-old assemblyman won the Democratic primary by defying the city’s all-powerful establishment. He secured the mayoralty by delicately disarming it.

title: Mamdani is New York’s First Muslim and South Asian Mayor-Elect
summary: Zohran Mamdani’s ascent was powered by a relentless focus on affordability. Along the way, he energized South Asian and Muslim communities that rarely receive sustained attention from politicians.

title: The Democrats Just Took a Big Step Toward Getting Their Groove Back
summary: Victories in New York City, New Jersey, Virginia and elsewhere were decisive, but new political tests loom for a party still rebuilding its brand.

title: Spanberger Wins Virginia Governor’s Race With Forceful Anti-Trump Campaign
summary: Abigail Spanberger, a former congresswoman and C.I.A. officer, will be the first woman to serve as governor of Virginia, following a streak of 74 men.

title: UPS Plane Crash Near Louisville Airport Kills at Least 7, Officials Say
summary: The plane crashed and exploded shortly after taking off from a Kentucky airport, disrupting operations at the delivery company’s main air cargo hub.

title: What We Know About the UPS Plane Crash in Louisville
summary: Seven people were dead after the cargo plane crashed soon after takeoff. The authorities canceled flights from the airport in Louisville, Ky., and local residents were ordered to remain indoors.

title: On Eve of Shutdown Record, Trump Officials Threaten Pain Could Worsen
summary: President Trump and administration officials indicated the fallout could intensify in the coming days, even as he has kept himself at a remove from the crisis.

title: Judge Expresses Alarm About ICE Detention Conditions in Broadview, Ill.
summary: Several former detainees described tight quarters, a lack of sanitation and little access to lawyers at the Broadview, Ill., immigration detention facility.

title: For Dick Cheney, a Journey From Champion of War to Voice of Resistance
summary: Dick Cheney was to many the embodiment of the unpopular and bloody Iraq war. But his late-in-life anti-Trumpism changed his image for some of his longtime critics.

title: Dick Cheney, Powerful Vice President and Washington Insider, Dies at 84
summary: A former defense secretary and congressman, he held the nation’s No. 2 job under President George W. Bush and was an architect of policies in an era of war and economic change.

title: How Cheney’s Presidential Power Push Paved the Way for Trump to Go Further
summary: Donald J. Trump and Dick Cheney became adversaries, but the former vice president set the stage for Mr. Trump’s bid to expand his executive authority.

title: Some Republicans Honor Dick Cheney, While Trump Remains Silent
summary: The late vice president had called President Trump “a coward” and a “threat to our republic” and supported Vice President Kamala Harris in 2024.

title: Trump Weighs Options, and Risks, for Attacks on Venezuela
summary: President Trump has yet to make a decision, but his advisers are pressing a range of objectives — from attacking drug cartels to seizing oil fields — to try to justify ousting Nicolás Maduro.

title: Latest U.S. Strike on Suspected Drug Boat Kills 2 in Pacific, Hegseth Says
summary: It was the 16th announced attack in two months and raised the death toll to at least 67 people in both the Caribbean Sea and the Pacific.

title: What to Know About the Legal Scandal in Israel Over Accusations of Abuse
summary: The fallout from a legal case has reignited a highly charged debate within the country over whether Israeli soldiers accused of abusing Palestinians are held accountable.

title: U.S. Seeks Two-Year U.N. Mandate for Gaza Stabilization Force
summary: A draft Security Council resolution said that an international force would ensure that Gaza be demilitarized, though specifics were unclear.

title: Right-Wing Chatbots Turbocharge America’s Political and Cultural Wars
summary: Once pitched as dispassionate tools to answer your questions, A.I. chatbots are now programmed to reflect the biases of their creators.

title: The Editor Got a Letter From ‘Dr. B.S.’ So Did a Lot of Other Editors.
summary: The rise of artificial intelligence has produced serial writers to science and medical journals, most likely using chatbots to boost the number of citations they’ve published.

title: How the Cop Show ‘Barney Miller’ Made Gay TV History, 50 Years Ago
summary: A 1975 episode introduced audiences to one of the first openly gay couples in mainstream American television not depicted as deviants or criminals.

title: Six Ways Zohran Mamdani Can Improve New York City
summary: Mamdani, who campaigned on sweeping promises, can build a positive legacy by focusing on tangible accomplishments.

title: Do Dumb Ideas Ever Die?
summary: Unlike old soldiers, they don’t even fade away.

title: Drone Strike Kills Dozens of Mourners at Funeral in Sudan
summary: The attack occurred in North Kordofan, which has seen an increased military buildup as the army and paramilitary forces jockey for control of the country.

title: Tom Brady Says He Cloned His Dog
summary: Mr. Brady became the latest celebrity to try to preserve a pet’s genetics, a move that animal rights groups have criticized.

title: Fugitive Who Faked Abduction Is Found 13 Years Later, Enrolled in N.Y. College
summary: Anthony Lennon, a convicted sex offender from Oklahoma, was arrested in Canton, N.Y., where he was studying under an alias, the authorities said.
